definition: to spoil one's appetite/fig. to get fed up with sth
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: She criticized what she described as the film's cloying sentimentality .
sentences.chinese: 她批评这部影片如她所说的令人倒胃口的伤感情调。

sentences.english: When anything is topsy-turvy , it turns my stomach.
sentences.chinese: 如果一切都乱七八糟，就会使我倒胃口。

sentences.english: Don't talk to me about that person. I'm tired of him.
sentences.chinese: 别再跟我谈那人，一提到他我就倒胃口。

sentences.english: The food at this hotel disgusts me .
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店的饭菜让我倒胃口。

sentences.english: Chocolates start to cloy if you eat too many.
sentences.chinese: 假如你吃太多巧克力会使你倒胃口。

sentences.english: I find the very sight of raw broccoli and cauliflower on a buffet table dispiriting.
sentences.chinese: 看到冷餐桌上那些生的花椰菜和花菜我就倒胃口。

sentences.english: These constructs soon become cloying and distracting.
sentences.chinese: 这些东西很快就变得倒胃口，令人心神不宁。

sentences.english: Chocolates start to cloy if you eat too much.
sentences.chinese: 假如你吃太多巧克力会使你倒胃口。

sentences.english: In fact, it may be a big turnoff for him.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，那可能会很让他倒胃口。

sentences.english: Some have referred to it by the unappetizing name "capital jelly ".
sentences.chinese: 某些人把它称为“资本浆糊”这一倒胃口的名字。

sentences.english: A constant diet of tripe will make anyone spiritually sick.
sentences.chinese: 常常废话使一切人精神上倒胃口。

definition: to feel sick/to feel nauseous/to feel disgusted
variant of 惡心|恶心[e3 xin1]
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
(Internet slang) (of a situation, video clip etc) to make one think "wtf!"
to be an eyesore/(fig.) to spoil the fun/to be a wet blanket
